videos.title: Adam Savage's New Neopixel Darksaber!
videos.description:
Adam Savage wields the Darksaber! We unbox and assemble this incredible replica Darksaber from SaberBay, the culmination of years of design iteration and collaboration between saber replica builders on the Replica Prop Forum. Housed inside this powder-coated machined hilt is the latest in fan-designed saber technologies, from sensors and speaker to programmable electronics that make the blade truly fun to play with. Just in time for May 4th!

Learn more about this Darksaber and other hilts at: https://www.saberbay.com/collections/hilts

TheRPF build thread for this hilt: https://www.therpf.com/forums/threads/saberbay-darksaber-season-3-finish-now-available-limited-quantities-saberbay-com.336532/
Hilt engineering and stand design by Gustavo: https://www.therpf.com/forums/members/guabe.7690/
Pixel blade by Saber Trade: http://thesabertrade.com/
Chasis and crystal chamber by Goth 3D Design: https://www.shapeways.com/shops/goth-customsabers?section=C14+-+Saberbay&s=0
Soundboard by Plecter Labs CFX: https://www.plecterlabs.com/
Switch and blade PCBs by Shtok Custom Worx: https://shtokcustomworx.com/
Box design by Khal from Kr-Sabers: https://www.krsabers.com/

Shot by Josh Self and edited by Norman Chan
Music by Jingpunks

videos.title: How Adam Savage's Cosplay Dress Form Was Made!
videos.description:
Adam welcomes Alison Hughes and Nate Barefield--the founders of Beatrice Forms--to the cave to learn how his custom dress form was made with a 3D scan of his body. Using one of Adam's favorite shirts and dinner jackets, they demonstrate why a good fit is so important to costuming and tailoring, and even surprise Adam with a miniature body-double mannequin created to his measurements!

Learn more about Beatrice Forms dress forms: https://beatriceforms.com/
Disclosure: Dress form was provided by manufacturer for purposes of review.

videos.title: Ruined?! What Happened to Adam Savage's Mercury Spacesuit
videos.description:
One of Adam's very first spacesuit replica projects was a NASA Mercury program Navy Mark IV pressure suit, but the materials he chose to recreate its iconic silver fabric have since completely deteriorated! That's why Adam is so thrilled to unveil his newest Mercury suit replica, constructed by costumer Christine Knobel (who worked on Adam's xEMU concept suit). Adam couldn't be happier with this latest iteration, and commences work on weathering the suit to make it look as if it's been part of the space program since the 60s. 

Find more of Christine Knobel's work at https://www.instagram.com/thestarflower/ 
Adam's xEMU suit build: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJtitKU0CAejUJOkTX4TYXt4mVhFzqS5H
Adam's first Mercury spacesuit: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aLOVS5Fl1OY

videos.title: How Star Wars: Ahsoka's Jedi Shuttle Filming Model Was Made!
videos.description:
During the production of Star Wars: Ahsoka, Adam Savage visited the miniatures filming stage set up at Lucasfilm to watch the practical model of Ahsoka's T-6 Jedi Shuttle being filmed. Modelmaker John Goodson and machinist Dan Patrascu spent four months building the 30-inch model of that T-6 ship for the show–an incredible hero ship model not only equipped with lights, but was fully mechanized with a rotating wing!

More Star Wars-related content here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=axiYo61XRRw&list=PLJtitKU0CAei6h_Ud6kldnpsr3xK2HN3t&index=1

videos.title: Fixing the Faulty Bambu A1 3D Printer
videos.description:
While we loved using the Bambu Lab A1 3D printer when we reviewed it last year, the printer has been out of service since Bambu Lab recalled every single A1 unit due to the heatbed cable at risk for damage. And with the replacement heatbed just arrived, let's end this week replacing it on the A1 and get this printer back into action. 

BambuLab A1 3D Printer: https://us.store.bambulab.com/products/a1?variant=41583355199624
Bambu A1 mini phone charger kit: https://us.store.bambulab.com/products/wireless-charger-kit-k012
About the A1 Heatbed Recall: https://blog.bambulab.com/a1-recall-update/

videos.title: Shooting Ballistic Gel Birds at Silicone Fabio with @bobbyfingers and @theslowmoguys!
videos.description:
Adam Savage is a HUGE fan of both @bobbyfingers and @theslowmoguys, so when he was approached to build an air cannon to shoot a ballistics gel goose at 75 mph at a silicone Fabio Lanzoni head in a Texas quarry, he was ALL over it! (Who wouldn't be?!) Here's the story of how Adam built the cannon, how this three-channel collaboration came together, and how he felt stepping back into his old MythBusters shoes. And be sure to watch @bobbyfingers' Fabio and the Goose: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2RIEPKEhE2s and @theslowmoguys' 75 MPH Bird to the Face: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w9i9rwg1L_A for the REST of the story.

@bobbyfingers ' Fabio and the Goose: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2RIEPKEhE2s  @theslowmoguys ' 75 MPH Bird to the Face: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w9i9rwg1L_A

videos.title: Adam Savage Designs His Dream Star Wars-Inspired Droid!
videos.description:
Submit your own design for a droid at http://www.autodesk.com/droid !

The upcoming Star Wars series The Acolyte–streaming June 4 on Disney Plus–will introduce Pip: a handheld repair droid developed by creature effects legend Neal Scanlan and designed in Autodesk’s Fusion software. Today, Adam sketches out his own idea for a Star Wars-inspired droid and invites Bill Doran to the workshop to turn that design into a working 3D-printed character!

Find more of Bill Doran's work at https://www.punishedprops.com/
Shot and edited by Norman Chan

Sponsored by Autodesk and Disney: In celebration of the newest Star Wars droid, Pip,  featured in the upcoming  series The Acolyte, Lucasfilm and Autodesk, a global leader in technology and software for Design and Make industries, are teaming up to launch a limited-time droid-design contest*. Fans can go to autodesk.com/droid to submit their own designs for a chance to win special grand prizes including a trip to and guided tour of the Lucasfilm headquarters in San Francisco, California, or The Walt Disney Studios Lot in Burbank, California and more. #MakeAnything #ad 
See the two-episode premiere of #TheAcolyte, a Star Wars Original series, June 4 on @DisneyPlus.

videos.title: @bobbyfingers Hidden Surprise!
videos.description:
As you know (and if you don't, stop reading right now to go to his channel), @bobbyfingers always hides his dioramas -- with clues -- for people to find each time he publishes a build. videos.title: How They're Made: Zero-Turn Riding Lawn Mowers!
videos.description:
This video is sponsored by Husqvarna. Learn more about Husqvarna chainsaws and tools at https://www.husqvarna.com/

We often talk about American manufacturing of tools, but what does that mean in 2024? Adam was recently invited to Husqvarna's factory and North American Design Headquarters in the Carolinas. There, Husqvarna engineers and technicians took us behind the scenes of their impressive two million square-foot manufacturing facility to follow the design, parts fabrication, and assembly of Husqvarna’s Xcite Zero-Turn Lawn Mower. Let's deep dive into the role that new technologies and processes play in modern machines made in the USA.

videos.title: Drilling a Hole the Width of a Human Hair?

This is the mechanized facehugger that was wrapped around Kane in Ridley Scott's orginal film, with details like the wiring around its fingers and tail that let puppeteers tighten its grip during filming. With the Aliens facehugger, we get to see how the creature's design evolved between films, and the disturbing sculpted fingernails still attached!

Adam unboxes an awesome gift from viewer Dylan Edmiston: a set of three epic hammers created in the style of the welded steamfitters hammer he made as a crew gift after the third season of Mythbusters! The unpacking of these hammers and accompanying letter becomes itself a lovely adventure, and Adam couldn't be more delighted by gifts. Thanks, Dylan!

videos.title: Life-Size T-Rex Dinosaur from Jurassic Park!
videos.description:
Effects legend Steve Wang introduces us to his 1:1 replica of the original T-Rex animatronic head that was created for the main road attack sequence in Jurassic Park! Steve explains how his team was able to scan the surviving original larger-than-life animatronic prop and cast for this paint master prototype, which took three weeks to assemble and paint. Check out the glass eyes on this creature, which were 3D-printed in full color!

Elite Creature Collectibles: https://www.elitecreature.com/

videos.title: Adam Savage Meets Original Men in Black Blasters!
videos.description:
What a treat! Adam gets to go hands-on with original hero blaster props created for Men in Black II and 3, examining the finely machined hardware that feels and weighs like real manufactured products. With working electronics and triggers that activate lights, these must've been a blast to use on set and are a great example of the iconic prop design of the Men in Black franchise.

videos.title: Adam Savage's Problem with Internet Photos
videos.description:
Adam's been thinking about this rant for a while: a common issue with photos of objects and projects he finds on internet forums is how poorly they relay critical information at a glance. Using a paint weathering tutorial as a demonstration, Adam shows what he means when he wants to "see" an object through the camera lens and what he thinks about every time he takes a photo to share.

videos.title: Adam Savage Meets The Original Star Trek Tricorder Prop!
videos.description:
Now this is truly a landmark piece of science fiction history. Adam get a chance to examine one of the surviving Tricorder props from Star Trek The Original Series, designed and built by Wah Chang. What's even more remarkable is that the prop is alongside Chang's original production sketch for the design of the Tricorder, which looks remarkably close to the final prop!

videos.title: How Figure Sculptors Achieve Hyperrealistic Detail!
videos.description:

We chat with the InArt team to learn how they achieve such fidelity at this size and scale, and preview their new line of StoneRow 1/12 scale figures as well.

videos.title: Why Star Trek's Graphic Design Makes Sense
videos.description:
Adam has the great pleasure of meeting Michael and Denise Okuda, designers and consultants who have been working on Star Trek shows and films for almost forty years. As the creators of the LCARS computer systems interface seen since Star Trek: The Next Generation, they guide Adam through a primer on Star Trek's graphic design and the logic of the fictional user interface affectionately known as "Okudagrams".

videos.title: Adam Savage's Favorite LEGO Brick
videos.description:
An ode to Adam Savage's all-time favorite LEGO brick: the venerable computer terminal block that's been a staple to any space-themed build for decades. These bricks were so precious to Adam that he made his own hand-drawn versions in his early LEGO-building days! Adam just discovered some custom screenprinted bricks from Brickrock Press with new space monitor computer displays, and shares some of his new favorites!

Brickrock Press: https://shop.brickrockpress.com/
James Brown's OLED Computer-in-a-brick: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6wBrOV2FJM8

videos.title: Adam Savage Gets Turned Into an Animated Puppet!
videos.description:
Adam welcomes director and animator Julian Curi to the cave! We're fans of Julian's lovely short films and puppet style, and get to learn about his design and animation processes with prototypes and puppet samples he's brought along with him. To illustrate how he makes and animates his puppets, Adam and Julian collaborate on two new figures putting Adam and his dog Maggie into an animated scene.

videos.title: Star Wars Stop-Motion AT-ST Scout Walker Replica!
videos.description:
We catch up with EFX Collectibles and their newest prototypes for a few Star Wars studio-scale replicas. Their newest take on the AT-ST Scout Walker is a replica of the surviving stop-motion puppet scanned at the Lucasfilm archives, recreated down to the support stand and display base that the original lives on today. We chat with EFX to learn about their approach to recreating these models, whether with digital scans or physical molds taken from the original props. 

Learn more about EFX Collectibles at: https://efxcollectibles.com/

videos.title: Why Adam Savage Is Fascinated by This Old Toolbag!
videos.description:
Adam reveals a personal fascination with the tools and equipment used by telecommunications engineers of the late 19th and early 20th century who built and maintained the system of analog telephone lines across the country. And of these linemans' tools he's collected and acquired of the years, this custom Bell Systems toolbag is among the most interesting and personal he's found so far!

videos.title: Adam Savage's Deep Dive Into Star Trek Prop Replicas!
videos.description:
What goes into making the perfect Star Trek Tricorder prop replica? Or how about a phaser with features fans have only imagined? Adam welcomes Factory Entertainment's creative director Barry Eldridge to the cave to check out prototypes of their wide range of Star Trek hand props, from a stunning Medical Tricorder to the VISOR as seen in Star Trek: The Next Generation!

videos.title: Adam Savage Installs a Collet Locker on His Lathe!
videos.description:
Here's another instance where one build begets another build. While working on the rack gears for his miniature vault build, Adam found himself in need of a better system to hold those parts in his lathe using a standard 5C collet. So instead of using his tried and true chuck, he disassembles part of his lathe to install a collet locker and closer to get the repeatability he'll need for this project.

videos.title: Adam Savage's New Spacesuit Wrist Rings!

videos.description:
NOTE: ADAM DOES NOT HAVE A NEW TATTOO! What you see on his right arm is a temporary tattoo from the Silo activation at San Diego Comic Con.

Adam begins a new animatronic puppet build, the specific details of which will be revealed in due time! videos.title: How Dragonriding Works in House of the Dragon!
videos.description:
In our final video from Adam's visit behind the scenes of House of the Dragon, we visit the special effects workshop where Special Effects Supervisor Michael Dawson shows Adam the different platforms fabricated by his team to allow actors to ride dragons on the show! From the Stewart platform used for Game of Thrones to a new 3-axis hydraulic-powered motion base that can be controlled on location, Michael describes the shooting requirements for these rigs and Adam stands on one to get a sense of the range of motion of these massive platforms!

videos.title: Adam Savage Assembles a Working 3D-Printed Mechanical Counter!
videos.description:
Let's wrap this week up with a fun 3D-printer project: the assembly of working mechanical segment counter. Adam is blown away by the design and elegance of this analog mechanical device, complete with printed countersunk screws and support-free parts. It's a testament to quality and tolerance of 3D printed parts you can get from modern machines as well as the ingenuity and generosity of designers who share their work for the community to print!

videos.title: Hands-On: Meta Orion Augmented Reality Glasses!
videos.description:
We go hands-on with Orion, the augmented reality glasses prototype that Meta's Reality Labs has spent the better part of a decade developing. It’s taken years and countless millions spent to get to this point: a 98 gram pair of glasses with an optical display system that can put holograms almost everywhere your eyes can look and an input system that seemingly reads your mind. The catch: each pair costs almost $10,000 to make--the kind of moonshot device they internally call a Time Machine. Let's dive deep into how Orion’s technology works, what it’s like to use them, and what this Time Machine reveals about the future of augmented reality.

Shot by Joey Fameli and edited by Norman Chan

videos.title: Why This Padlock Is Special!
videos.description:
Adam has acquired two new padlocks for his shop, each representing opposite ends of the security spectrum. The first is a 3D printed padlock by Jon Daigle of Daigles Dynamic Designs that's unique in that it was printed entirely in-place--no assembly required. videos.title: Secrets of Gold-Inlaid Weapon and Armor-Making Tools! (at @metmuseum!)
videos.description:
At the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Arms and Armor conservation lab, Adam Savage is blown away by an armorer's complete collection of tools, but that's not all! Associate conservator Sean Belair explains the ancient art of damascening -- producing a design or pattern by inlaying a softer metal into a harder one -- and shows Adam some mind-blowing examples of that intricate geometric work, which would have been completed with simple tools like these. It's an emotional moment for Adam as he contemplates the tools and the work of these extraordinary makers. Do you ever contemplate the makers of artifacts in museums?

This Ancient Mace Hides a Big Surprise: https://youtu.be/mrMdYFJ0fqA
Adam Savage Meets Real Armored Gauntlets: https://youtu.be/59-9PlB-F1Y

videos.title: Adam Savage in Carbonite One Day Build!
videos.description:
Adam completes a dream build: turning himself into a life-size frozen-in-carbonite statue to hang in his workshop! Utilizing the frame of a previous Han in Carbonite build, Adam pieces together a mix of 3D printed and milled foam parts from a full body 3D scan done at FBFX. It's like putting together a life-size model kit, complete with body filling, additional sculpting, painting, and weathering to tie it all together. Hanging this display up in the workshop is no easy feat, either!

videos.title: 3D-Printing At Human Scale—Form 4L Review!

videos.title: Adam Savage Reacts to REAL Buzz Lightyear Robot!
videos.description:
Ever since we saw the original Toy Story almost thirty years ago, we've wanted a Buzz Lightyear robot that captures the character and experience of Andy's toy seen on screen. Robosen's new Buzz Lightyear robot feels as close as we can get to a real Buzz Lightyear--fully animatronic with voice control and the ability to perform and react just as we imagined the iconic toy would if it came alive. Here's how it compares with the Lightyear animatronic--two completely different aesthetic takes on the same character!

Robosen Buzz Lightyear: https://www.robosen.com/

videos.title: Testing the Limits of Delivery Drones! (with @theslowmoguys)
videos.description:
Highly automated drone delivery has moved out of the realm of science fiction and is already taking place in deployment all around the world. Wing is a company that uses small aircraft to do last mile delivery of small packages–like a lunch order or urgently-needed supplies. Adam Savage visits the airfield where Wing conducts test flights to learn how these aircraft operate, how they’re tested, and what happens if a drone delivery doesn’t go according to plan. 

Learn more about Wing drone delivery at: https://www.youtube.com/@Wing

videos.title: Adam Savage Unboxes the Batmobile From Batman (1989)!
videos.description:
Adam unboxes the long-awaited 1989 Batmobile made by the 1/6 scale modelmakers and fabricators at Jazzinc Dioramas! We dive into the history and origins of this iconic vehicle, the most difficult parts to get accurate in a scaled replica, and the feat of design and engineering it took to make this collectible. At 44 inches long, it's tough to call this a miniature!

videos.title: Adam Savage Meets MacReady's Hat from The Thing!

videos.title: Adam Savage's Dino Build: Building the Infrastructure (Ep 1)
videos.description:
It's back! Adam Savage has always been obsessed with building a walkaround full-size velociraptor costume. In fact, he started this costume build 4 years ago, and at long last will be finishing it with the help of a few collaborators in the workshop. But first, let's recap how Adam got to this point, speed building and experimenting with the movement mechanisms of the raptor way back in 2020.

videos.title: This Wood-Turned Cup Is Actually 74 Cups! (at @metmuseum)
videos.description:
During our most recent visit to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Adam Savage spent an ENTIRE DAY at the @metmuseum's Department of Objects Conservation, which is responsible for the physical care and technical study of three-dimensional works of art. And to kick off this series is this EXTRAORDINARY wooden cup filled with 73 identical cups, each turned on a lathe individually from 74 pieces of maple. What's going on here? Managing Conservation Preparator Frederick Sager explains.

More about this cup: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/856907

videos.title: Quick Look at Sony's PlayStation 5 Pro!
videos.description:
This is the PlayStation 5 Pro, the mid-generation refresh of the now 4-year-old PS5. It’s releasing this week for $700 dollars, and we’ve been using it for the past few days, testing it out on a selection of games whose developers have patched to take advantage of the 45% faster rendering and the new PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution upscaler. videos.title: Adam Savage in Real Time: Giving the New (Old) Lathe Some Love
videos.description:

videos.title: Art Preservation Hidden in Plain Sight (at @metmuseum)
videos.description:
When the Crown of the Andes -- consisting of 5 POUNDS of gold and 400+ emeralds -- arrived at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, its delicate gold arches were sagging, threatening to collapse on itself. In order to be handled and displayed safely, the priceless artifact needed a permanent but reversible mounting system that would provide support while remaining visually discrete. Luckily, conservation preparator Matthew Cumbie was up for the task, and explains to Adam Savage just how he tackled the challenge. (No pressure!)

More about this crown: https://www.metmuseum.org/about-the-met/conservation-and-scientific-research/conservation-stories/2020/crown-of-andes
Met's Object Conservation Department: https://www.metmuseum.org/about-the-met/conservation-and-scientific-research/objects-conservation
This Wood-Turned Cup Is Actually 74 Cups! https://youtu.be/xhzZkD6gytg

videos.title: Adam Savage Explores Wing’s Drone Engineering Workshop!
videos.description:
Autonomous drone delivery has moved out of the realm of science fiction and is already taking place in deployment all around the world. And the aircraft that make these deliveries–like the ones used by Wing–have to be designed from the ground up. We visited the Wing’s workshop and labs where they dream up new aircraft, engineer them for the task of automated delivery, and have even built a wind tunnel to test custom propellers.

Learn more about Wing drone delivery at: https://www.youtube.com/@Wing

videos.title: Adam Savage's Dino Build: The Great Jaw Mech Fail (Ep 3)
videos.description:
One of the first tasks to tackle in Adam's revival of his velociraptor costume build is the animatronics that make the jaw and eyes move. It's a bit of mechanical problem solving to adapt the existing neck structure to the new head sculpted by Gary Staab. And while it's not a complicated solution, the implementation of a bicycle brake-like push-pull system proves more challenging than Adam expected. 

Gary Staab's TEDx Talk: Studying the dead to understand life: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8LWfb9fId_o
Learn more about Gary Staab's work at https://www.staabstudios.com/

Special thanks to the team at Animax Designs for making this build possible! https://www.animaxdesigns.com/

videos.title: XREAL One + One Pro Hands-On Impressions!
videos.description:
Something has changed within these. We go hands-on with XREAL's newly announced One and One Pro smart glasses that put a large spatial display in front of you while connected to your phone, laptop, or game console. The integration of a custom X1 processor now allows built-in 3DOF tracking, a feature we've long waited for with XREAL's products. But the bigger deal may be the optics on the higher-end Pro model. Let's dive in!

XREAL One: https://amzn.to/3ZCLfZ1
Learn more about these glasses at http://www.xreal.com
Note: Hands-on was conducted on pre-consumer release hardware and software, which may reflect a different experience from the latest consumer release.

videos.title: Could the Wright Flyer Work as an RC Airplane?
videos.description:
Adam welcomes Wing CEO Adam Woodworth into the cave to take a look at a selection of his personal RC plane projects, including several novel builds that push the limits of traditional model aircraft design!

Learn more about Wing drone delivery at: https://www.youtube.com/@Wing
Testing the Limits of Delivery Drones: https://youtu.be/YhNfeejuByI
Adam Savage Explores Wing’s Drone Engineering Workshop!: https://youtu.be/_BXm6dTHvY0

Want to get more involved in the RC hobby? Here are some helpful resources recommended by Adam Woodworth:

Academy of Model Aeronautics (AMA): https://www.modelaircraft.org/
The AMA is the leading organization for model aviation enthusiasts in the U.S., dedicated to safety, education, and advocacy. They provide insurance coverage for members, organize competitions, and advocate for model aviation interests with government agencies.

Flite Test: https://www.flitetest.com/
This website is a fantastic resource for RC airplane and drone enthusiasts of all skill levels. They offer build plans, product reviews, tutorials, and a supportive online community.

RCGroups: https://www.rcgroups.com/
This is one of the largest online forums dedicated to radio-controlled hobbies, including airplanes, drones, cars, and boats. It's an excellent place to find information, ask questions, and connect with other RC enthusiasts.

videos.title: Adam Savage Stunned by These Paintings-Turned-Sculptures!
videos.description:
Adam visits the workshop of prop designer and fabricator Pierre Bohanna who, among many other things, was responsible for making hero costumes and props for films like The Dark Knight, Edge of Tomorrow, and the Harry Potter Series. But outside his work for the film industry, Pierre's Bohanna Art studio has taken on the challenge of turning iconic paintings like Rousseau's "Tiger in a Tropical Storm" and van Gogh's "Sunflowers" into unique 3D sculptures, each more mind-blowing than the next. 

Learn more about Pierre Bohanna's bespoke art pieces at https://www.bohannaart.com/

videos.title: Adam Savage Levels Up His Workshop 3D Printer!
videos.description:
Adam kicks off the new year with a massive 3D printer upgrade to his workshop! After diving deep into FDM printing and integrating SLA printing into his builds, he's finally trying his hand at SLS (Selective Laser Sintering) Nylon printing using the Formlabs Fuse. Getting this new system set up in the cave and calibrated is the first step, and then Adam and Norm try their hands first prints to examine the unique qualities of sintered nylon. videos.title: Adam Savage Inside the Props Department for Silo Season 2!
videos.description:
Adam returns to the props department of SILO during the show's second season production to check out some unique prop weapons and bespoke diving gear created to fit within the story and world of SILO! Here's a glimpse into how some props are made to look great but be safe to wield for filming, while others can be designed to embed real functionality!

videos.title: What Museums Don’t Want You to Notice (at @metmuseum)
videos.description:
Have you ever thought about museum mounts? Likely not, and that's deliberate. In the case of this centuries-old vanity box, @metmuseum's curators, designers and mount makers worked together to make sure no ugly brace was reflected its mirror as admirers crane their necks to admire the piece, distracting from the aesthetics.  Warren Bennett -- conservation preparator at Met Metropolitan Museum of Art's Department of Objects Conservation -- takes Adam Savage through the painstaking mount-making process he pursued so visitors can appreciate the art without interruption while still protecting the artifact.

More about this artifact: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/681122
Met's Object Conservation Department: https://www.metmuseum.org/about-the-met/conservation-and-scientific-research/objects-conservation
Art Preservation Hidden in Plain Sight: https://youtu.be/yf48x0EN-ls

videos.title: What's Special About This @metmuseum Mount?
videos.description:
When deciding how to display an 18th century powder horn and a 19th century shoulder strap, the artifacts' curator and mount maker at @metmuseum had quite the challenge: How could they make the two pieces dynamic and exciting while still making sure they are well preserved? Managing conservation preparator Frederick Sager of @metmuseum's  Department of Objects Conservation explains how he and his colleague achieved what they feel is the best balance between aesthetics, engineering and conservation.

videos.title: Engineering “Floating” Mounts at @metmuseum!
videos.description:
Small objects such as jewelry can be challenging for museums to display. It's not compelling to lie them down in a case; curators want as close to a 360-degree view as possible, and the items might also need to shown open or as if they were being worn. But NO one wants the mount to distract from the craftsmanship of the artifact, or to interfere with its preservation. Here are three examples of historic pieces of jewelry -- a watch from 1670, a bracelet from the 18th or 19th century,  and a 17th century pocket watch -- and their very unique mounts, as presented to Adam Savage by @metmuseum conservation preparators Jacob Goble, Warren Bennett and Laila Lott. 

More about the watch: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/194113
More about the hathphul: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/450394
More about the pocket watch: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/194007

videos.title: What Adam Savage Has Learned About 3D Printing Nylon!
videos.description:

videos.title: Tips on Managing Stress
videos.description:
NOTE: No, that's not Jamie on Adam's shirt. More about Adam's T: https://defector.com/please-welcome-defectors-new-chief-metaverse-officer-devin-the-dugong

videos.title: How to Paint Historical Artifacts Safely (at @metmuseum)
videos.description:
At @metmuseum, the object conservation department is always working with archival materials. How do they know which, such as paint, are safe to use on or around the artifacts? videos.title: How the @metmuseum Mounts, Restores and Conserves Its Objects
videos.description:
While Tested has had the honor of filming at @metmuseum before, this was our first time in their object conservation department, which is responsible for the preservation and treatment of all three-dimensional art (outside of arms and armor), from the earliest antiquity to the latest commission. What are the challenges of such an a high-stakes charge? Adam Savage chats with Lisa Pilosi, Sherman Fairchild Conservator in Charge of Objects Conservation, about how the Met approaches mounting, preserving and conserving their collection.

videos.title: Adam Savage Builds a T-Rex Stop-Motion Armature!
videos.description:
Adam has long admired effects artist Phil Tippett's mastery of creature movement and the way he animated his stop-motion puppets, including the ones Phil made for Jurassic Park that never made it to film. To pay tribute to Phil's work, Adam begins a replica of the T-Rex puppet that sits in Tippett Studio's lobby, starting with a printed 3D scan of the head and manually machining all the joints and clevis hinges that make up its neck.

videos.title: Weathering FAIL: Rock Tumbler Meets Lighter (From Constantine)
videos.description:
One of Adam's favorite prop replicas is this lighter from the 2005 comic book adaptation of Constantine. Not only is it a beautifully made prop, but it's the kind of object that visually wears over time with handling and use. To acclerate its natural wear, Adam tries aging it in a rock tumbler filled with a drawer full of old keys--the idea of making it look like it's been living in someone's pocket for years.

videos.title: The Day Adam Savage Fell in Love (With Armor)
videos.description:

videos.title: How The Original Ghostbusters Ghost Trap Worked!
videos.description:
Adam encounters one of the actual ghost trap props used on screen for Ghostbusters I and II, and this is a special one. Connected to the original transmitter controller used on set, this ghost trap is packed full of practical effects that not only let it open and close, but activate all the flashing and blinking lights that we saw in the films. Adam takes a look inside this iconic prop to see how the effects technicians made it work over 40 years ago!

videos.title: Making Custom T-Shirts with xTool's Apparel Printer!
videos.description:
We dive into the world of custom shirt printing with the testing of xTool's new Apparel Printer (https://www.xtool.com/products/xtool-apparel-printer-a-new-era-of-apparel-printing). Utilizing two Epson print heads, this machine makes full color Direct-to-Film (DTF) transfers which can be heat pressed onto a variety of fabrics and materials. videos.title: [ASL/ACCESSIBILITY ENABLED] Adam Savage’s Ingenious Fractal Vise Mod!
videos.description:
NOTE: THIS IS NOT THE ONLY VERSION OF THE VIDEO! Non-ASL cut is here: https://youtu.be/5Vjw6c3BDPU

YOUR FEEDBACK IS WANTED. These ASL videos are an experiment. What do you think? What videos would you like to see us create ASL versions for?
ASL composite, closed captioning and descriptive audio track provided by the Described and Captioned Media Program (DCMP); learn more at https://dcmp.org

Adam tunes and modifies his fractal vise to improve its already impressive gripping powers! If you've ever wondered how these marvels of clamping worked, today is the perfect day to find out as Adam has to fully disassemble this vise to smooth out the movements of its individual semi-circles. But Adam goes further in adding even more granular teeth to those half moons, making it possible for the vise to comfortably grab ahold of a glass soda bottle!

Adam unboxing this fractal vise: https://youtu.be/NUhrF0xkhhc
Original non-ASL version: https://youtu.be/5Vjw6c3BDPU
Fractal vise: https://www.alibaba.com/product-detail/Fractal-Vise_1600318578412.html

videos.title: Adam Savage Builds an Artificial Heart Replica!
videos.description:
One of Adam's lesser-known obsessions is the Jarvik-7, the first artificial heart successfully implanted in a patient in 1982. This elegantly engineered device is beautiful in its delicate operation and aesthetic design, and Adam has been working with propmaker Bill Doran in making his own 3D-printed replica. Making use of our resin and SLS printers, Adam builds his interpretation of the Jarvik-7 and shares the files for anyone to print their own!

Find the 3D model for this Jarvik-7 artificial heart replica here: https://www.printables.com/model/1258871-jarvik-7-artificial-heart-nonfunctional-model

videos.title: When to Admit Defeat
videos.description:
How does one walk the line between generalist and know-it-all? Has a hobbyist convention goer ever shown Adam Savage a build that was professional-grade? Should you ever walk away from a project and admit defeat? In this live stream excerpt Adam answers these questions from Tested members Bill Rudd, the Great Brandino and Righteous Robot, whom we thank for their support! Have you ever abandoned a project? What were the circumstances?

videos.title: Adam Savage Examines This Steampunk GPS System!
videos.description:
Adam is floored by the RadioScout, a whimsical handheld GPS navigation system created by the propmakers at Hardly Human FX. Using an rotary dial to lay in target coordinates, this steampunk-style device not only has a lovely antique aesthetic but also has a tactility that feels great in hand to use. Thanks so much to Jace and Vic for delivering it!
